text: Charles Hewes Moore Jr. (August 12, 1929 - October 8, 2020) was an American track and field athlete. Moore won a gold medal and a silver medalist in the 400 metre hurdles in the 1952 Summer Olympics with a time of 50.8 seconds. In 1999, he was added into the United States National Track and Field Hall of Fame. Moore was born in Coatesville, Pennsylvania. Moore died on October 8, 2020 in Laporte, Pennsylvania at the age of 91.Charlie Moore ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:American hurdlers Category:Philanthropists from Pennsylvania Category:Businesspeople from Pennsylvania Category:Sportspeople from Pennsylvania
title: Charles Moore (athlete)
